alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 10:25AM EST until January 08 at 2:42PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Congaree National Park. This will begin to produce flooding of portions of the lower boardwalk. At 17.0 feet, The access road to the Sandy Run subdivision becomes flooded. The lower boardwalk in the Congaree National Park becomes flooded by Cedar Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
